Dear Tia Cobb:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the violations
identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The corrective action plan is
due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result in
compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact me. In
any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an acceptable
corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any questions. In
the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone immediately, please contact
the area manager Jessica VandenHeuvel at 616-204-6992.
Sincerely,
Shannon (Shay) Mavis

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions
Title & (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Section policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
Description intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
1

Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation A youth and staff engaged in a physical altercation. The staff
sustained a fractured wrist. The youth has a small scratch on his
face.
Investigation INTERVIEWS:
Complainant was interviewed face to face at the facility on
11/14/24. Complainant didn’t have any further information.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on
11/14/24. Youth A reported he and Staff 1 were walking from the
gym to the pod. Youth A reported he got irritated because Staff 1
told him he was walking slow and to walk faster. Youth A reported
when he and Staff 1 entered the pod, Staff 1 told Youth A he was
a “fake gangbanger”. Youth A reported he told Staff 1 to shut up.
Youth A reported Staff 1 told Youth A to step into the control room
to fight him, but Youth A refused. Youth A reported he grabbed the
plastic garbage can and tried to hit Staff 1 with it, but Staff 1
grabbed it from him before he could. Youth A reported Staff 1
pushed him into one of the doors on the pod, and then they both
began punching each other. Youth A reported the fight stopped
because Supervisor and Manager came onto the pod to break it
up. Youth A reported he didn’t have any injuries from the
altercation. Youth A reported he had never seen Staff 1 fight with
anyone at the facility before, including him.
Staff 1 was interviewed via phone on 12/9/24 in coordination
with MDHHS Worker. Staff 1 reported he and Youth A were
walking in the hallway toward the pod, and he asked Youth A why
he was walking slow. Staff 1 reported Youth A got upset, but Staff
1 didn’t know why. Staff 1 reported Youth A told him to “shut the
fuck up” and was threatening him, but Staff 1 could not provide an
example for how Youth A was threatening him. Staff 1 reported
when they got in the pod, Youth A threw toast at him, then Staff 1
threw the toast back at Youth A, and then Youth A threw it at Staff
1 a second time. Staff 1 reported Youth A got a hold of his radio,
pressed the button and requested security come get Staff 1 off the
pod. Staff 1 reported he got a phone call on the phone in the
control room, and when he answered it, Youth A smacked him in
the back of his head. Staff 1 reported Supervisor was on the
phone and told Staff 1 back up was coming. Staff 1 reported when
he and Youth A exited the control room, Youth A attacked him
with a trash can, and then they both got into a physical altercation
punching each other. Staff 1 reported he received a fractured
bone on his left wrist/lower forearm and received a cast. Staff 1
reported he didn’t call for back up sooner because he didn’t feel it
2

was necessary or it was a big deal. Staff 1 reported after Youth A
pressed the radio, he didn’t have time to call for back up because
Youth A had already requested back up. Staff 1 reported if youth
are physically aggressive or attack staff, staff are supposed to try
to talk the youth down or physically restrain them, if possible. Staff
1 reported he tried to talk Youth A down by saying “calm down, it’s
not that serious”, but Youth A kept responding by saying, “shut the
fuck up. I’ll beat your ass.”
Supervisor was interviewed face to face at the facility on
11/14/24. Supervisor reported Staff 1 called on the radio
requesting a supervisor, but didn’t clarify whether it was an
emergency or non-emergency. Supervisor reported he requested
more information and Staff 1 replied “you need to come get this
boy”. Supervisor reported he then knew the situation was urgent,
so he rushed to the pod. Supervisor reported when he arrived on
the pod, he and Manager didn’t have to do much to separate them
because Youth A and Staff 1 had stopped their physical
altercation before Supervisor walked in the room. Supervisor
reported Staff 1’s face was bleeding, and he was out of breath.
Supervisor reported he told Staff 1 to get off the pod, so Manager
walked Staff 1 out. Supervisor reported Youth A attempted to
punch him, but he avoided it. Supervisor reported he tried to talk
to Youth A to find out what happened, but Youth A didn’t want to
talk. Supervisor reported he talked to Staff 1 and Staff 1 told him
Youth A was bothering him for the longest time (i.e. spitting on
him, slapping him, throwing things at him, etc.). Supervisor
reported he didn’t understand why Staff 1 didn’t call for help earlier
since all those things were happening. Supervisor reported Staff 1
should have called for help earlier before it became a bigger
situation. Supervisor reported when he mentioned this to Staff 1,
Staff 1 reported he didn’t know why he didn’t call for help earlier.
Manager was interviewed face to face at the facility on
11/14/24. Manager reported Staff 1 called over the radio
requesting for someone to come to Pod C. Manager reported she
and Supervisor walked down to the pod and entered it at the same
time. Manager reported when they entered the pod, Youth A was
exchanging words with Staff 1, but he was yelling and was so loud
she couldn’t understand what he was saying. Manager reported
she stepped sideways to get in between Staff 1 and Youth A, but
Youth A reached over her and punched Staff 1 in the mouth.
Manager reported Supervisor stepped in front of Youth A and
Youth A tried to hit him, so Supervisor and Manager continued to
try and verbally de-escalate Youth A and Staff 1. Manager
reported Supervisor continued to talk to Youth A and Youth A
3

calmed down, so Manager pushed Staff 1 towards the exit and
made him leave the pod.
VIDEO REVIEWED:
Video footage from Pod C on 11/6/24 was reviewed. It should be
noted the video does not have audio. Staff 1 and Youth A are the
only ones seen on the pod. They are standing a few feet away
from each other and Youth A has his fists up swaying back and
forth towards Staff 1. Youth A walks around the chair and Staff 1
also walks around the chair. Staff 1 takes a step towards Youth A,
then turns around and walks away from Youth A. Staff 1 sits down
in a chair while Youth A remains standing. Youth A then sits down
in a chair at the table. Youth A picks something up off the table
and throws it at Staff 1. The item falls on the floor next to Staff 1.
Youth A sits back in his chair for less than a minute, and then
bends over, picks up the object and throws it at Staff 1 again,
more forcefully. Youth A stands up in front of Staff 1 and then
walks away towards one of the pod doors. Youth A and Staff 1
exchange words. Then Youth A enters the staff control room. Staff
1 gets up and stands outside of the control room. Youth A remains
in the control room while Staff 1 stands outside the control room
with his back turned. Youth A comes out of the control room with
an object in his hand similar in shape/size of a box. Youth A and
Staff 1 exchange words and then Staff 1 sits back down. Staff 1
stands back up and Youth A puts the object on the table. Youth A
and Staff 1 exchange words. Youth A goes back into the control
room and Staff 1 follows him inside. Through the small window,
Staff 1 can be seen pushing Youth A backwards out of the control
room door. Once he is pushed back into the milieu, Youth A puts
his fists up like he is going to fight. Youth A takes a step towards
Staff 1 and swings at him, but it cannot be seen if Youth A hits
Staff 1 or not. Staff 1 goes back into the control room. Youth A
stands just inside the control room door. Staff 1 walks towards
Youth A quickly, and Youth A backs up quickly out of the control
room, so they are both out in the milieu. Staff 1 picks up the object
that looks like a box off the table in the milieu and starts walking
towards the control room. Youth A grabs onto the object but Staff
1 continues walking and Youth A lets go. Staff 1 puts the object in
the control room. Staff 1 walks out of the control room and stands
within a couple feet from Youth A. Youth A is talking to Staff 1 and
Staff 1 raises his arm and backhands Youth A in the face. Youth A
puts his arms up and hits Staff 1 twice and they both take a step
back. Staff 1 backs up into the control room and Youth A steps
towards the control room with his fists up. He then drops his fists,
walks towards the garbage can in the milieu, and picks it up. Staff
1 exits the control room and charges at Youth A, backing him up
4

against the wall, and begins punching him. Youth A holds his arms
up and begins punching Staff 1 back. Staff 1 is grabbing onto
Youth A’s arm in between punches. Youth A gets away from Staff
1 and stands across the milieu. They continue to exchange words.
Less than a minute later, Supervisor, Manager and multiple other
staff enter the pod. Manager and Supervisor immediately get in
between Youth A and Staff 1. Youth A tries to punch Supervisor,
but Supervisor dodges him and backs away. Manager has her
arm out to hold Staff 1 back. Then Manager exits the pod with
Staff 1.
DOCUMENTS REVIEWED:
• Agency response strategy dated 11/18/24 confirms Staff 1
was taken off duty working with youth pending the
investigation and was completing administrative duties at
Calumet Center.
• Incident report “Resident Assault on Staff” dated 11/6/24
authored by Supervisor states Youth A refused to follow
directives by Staff 1. Youth A engaged in a verbal
altercation with Staff 1 and then assaulted Staff 1 by
punching and kicking him in the face. Supervisor along with
Staff 2 and Staff 3 arrived on the pod to verbally de-
escalate the situation, removed Staff 1 and counseling
Youth A.
• Discipline Policy states any type of physical discipline is
prohibited.
• Youth Discipline & Behavior Modification Policy states any
type of physical discipline is prohibited. The use of verbal
and non-physical crisis intervention should be utilized first
and may prevent the need for physical intervention. A youth
initiating physical contact with a staff or another person with
the intent of controlling or harming that person and/or picks
up something to use as a weapon is considered a physical
assault. The appropriate staff response is to use a safe
physical management procedure to control the youth and
then use the Behavior Management Procedure until the
youth is under physical and emotional control. Physical
restraint involves the application of approved holding
techniques to diffuse a youth who is dangerous to himself,
others, or program property.
• Staff 1 does not have any disciplinary records in his
employee file. Staff 1 completed Crisis Intervention –
5

Handle with Care Physical Practicum training on 3/14/24.
Staff 1 completed MANDT physical skills training on
8/22/24 and MANDT verbal de-escalation techniques
training on 8/23/24. Staff 1 completed youth rule
violation/discipline consequence review trainings on
1/26/24, 2/8/24, 2/23/24, 2/28/24, 3/8/24 and 6/28/24.
Analysis The facility is found in non-compliance as per interviews
conducted, video reviewed, and documentation reviewed, Staff 1
got into a physical altercation with Youth A, which included Staff 1
punching Youth A multiple times as well as pushing him.
Technical Assistance:
The following technical assistance was offered:
- Staff at the facility need to ensure they are aware of
appropriate times to call for back-up (i.e. when they’re
frustrated, when a youth is becoming escalated, etc.) even
if they feel they have a good relationship with a youth, or
the youth has never been aggressive with them previously.
- Staff need to ensure the control room door remains closed,
so youth do not have access to the control room.
- Technical assistance was offered to the facility on 9/11/24
to update their Discipline & Behavior Modification policy to
ensure it addresses all aspects of the licensing restraint
rules and their subsections as outlined, prohibiting the
specific items noted. This is being provided again as the
policy has not yet been updated.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
